oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Davis, Theodore (1840-1894)
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Chattanooga Valley from side of Missionary Ridge
Missionary Ridge, view of Chattanooga Valley
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This scene, rendered in ink and wash, depicts a ravaged-looking forested hillside with a cloud or smoke-shrouded mountain in the distance and smoke also rising from various locations in the valley in between.

Theodore Davis (1840-1894) was a "Special Artist" for news magazines such as Harper's Weekly and Leslie's Illustrated Weekly, illustrating news reports from the front. He was in the Chattanooga area in 1863 and 1864. Davis also made drawings for various publications in the decades after the Civil War.
